text: Mary Magdalene, Artemisia Gentileschi, 1616–1618, Pitti Palace, Florence Mary Magdalene is a 1616-1618 painting by the Italian baroque artist Artemisia Gentileschi. It hangs in the Pitti Palace in Florence. == Description == The figure is portrayed in a gown of yellow silk, pushing away a mirror (a symbol of vanity) inscribed with the words Optimam partem elegit (“you have chosen the best part”). == References == category:1610s paintings Category:Paintings by Artemisia Gentileschi Category:Paintings of the Galleria Palatina Category:Paintings depicting Mary Magdalene
title: Mary Magdalene (Artemisia Gentileschi)
